thread.title: Israel's Delek Group sells Faroe stake for 70 mln pounds

title: Israel's Delek Group sells Faroe stake for 70 mln pounds
text:
April 4, 2018 / 6:52 AM / Updated 13 minutes ago Israel's Delek Group sells Faroe stake for 70 million pounds Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
TEL AVIV (Reuters) - Israeli energy firm Delek Group ( DLEKG.TA ) said on Wednesday it agreed to sell its entire 15.3 percent stake in Faroe Petroleum PLC ( FPM.L ) for 70.44 million pounds in cash. 
Delek said in a statement the deal will close within two business days. It did not name the buyer. 
Delek will make a profit of 116 million shekels (Â£23.3 million) from the sale, of which 73 million shekels will be recorded in its 2018 financial results and the rest in 2017. 
Faroe is an oil and gas exploration and production company operating in the North Sea. Reporting by Tova Cohen, reporting by Louise Heavens
